===Etymology===
From an unidentified language in the {{w|Western Regions}}, perhaps a Prakrit language (e.g. {{etyl|pgd|zh}}). Compare {{cog|pi|veḷuriya||precious stone, maybe [[lapis lazuli]]}}, {{cog|sa|वैडूर्य|sc=Deva|tr=vaiḍūrya||cat's-eye, beryl}}.<ref>'''1917''', ''Field Museum of Natural History: 1909'', “The Beginnings of Porcelain in China”, Berthold Laufer and Henry Windsor Nichols, The Museum, [http://books.google.com/books?id=BnEuAAAAYAAJ&dq=veluriya%20liuli&pg=PA138#v=onepage&q=veluriya%20liuli&f=false page 138]:
: The glassy paste for the production of ceramic glazes was called ''liu-li'' {{lang|zh|琉璃}} (in the Han Annals {{lang|zh|流離}}) or ''p'i-liu-li'', derived from Prākrit ''veluriya'', Mahārāshṭrī ''verulia'' (Sanskrit ''vaiḍūrya'').</ref>
